column5: Hope nobody got caught in any bad road situations this evening . Just got back from Orangeville and the roads are terrible . Several vehicles in ditches and what looked like a head on just north of Orangeville on #10 . Looks like we got around 15-20 cm here in north Dufferin today .
Not so much accumulation last night coming back from Collingwood, but 3-4 inches of heavy slush will suck even the heaviest of pickups toward the ditch.  Quite the ride to say the least.
Bright & sunny over here in the Kawarthas but sposed to get a few flurries later on.
Just rain here in Whitby.  And only between 10pm and midnight.   Most of it missed here completely.
Wet snow for most of the day at St Jakobs, yesterday. Nothing sticking to the ground. Just wet.
Making ice up here in NW ontario!!!!  -15 ish the past few days!!!
About 4" of super wet compacted snow up here. Still coming down steady. Don't worry... 10C on Thursday!
About 4" of super wet compacted snow up here. Still coming down steady. Don't worry... 10C on Thursday!   Ya crazy weather Wayne. I can see the huge wall from here up your way. It is massive.
As long as it stays up there, I don't have to shovel..
Up to 8" now.. have to push the shovel each way from house to shop each time I come in. Oh well, we got our wood in and don't have to leave the property to go to work tomorrow !!

For those lucky or unlucky folks (depends on how you look at it) that are heading out this weekend to do a little fishing be aware that the Georgian Bay snow belts are expecting 15-30 cm of snow Friday -  Sunday . Special weather statements have just been issued for the Parry Sound area and down through Muskoka . The area will probably be expanding along with some weather warnings being issued in the next day . Be prepared for winter driving conditions in this area over the weekend .

Why I cancelled Thursday and Friday fishing. Leah and I have been busting our butts, until we can't stand up, getting our firewood out of the bush and piled before it's lost in the mess. Figure we have two more 8 hour days, just to get everything that I have cut and split on the ground loaded / out of the bush and piled.  I'm just hoping they're very wrong...  .... just  looked at weather. It shows no accum for Friday, less than 1cm Sat and 1 to 3 on Sunday (for Midland anyhow!)

Why I cancelled Thursday and Friday fishing. Leah and I have been busting our butts, until we can't stand up, getting our firewood out of the bush and piled before it's lost in the mess. Figure we have two more 8 hour days, just to get everything that I have cut and split on the ground loaded / out of the bush and piled.  I'm just hoping they're very wrong...  .... just  looked at weather. It shows no accum for Friday, less than 1cm Sat and 1 to 3 on Sunday (for Midland anyhow!) And tomorrow it will call for all sunny days

LOL I just looked as well Wayne. It will be hit and mis. What to do, what to do.  As for the wood thing, I wasnt able to help the parents this fall. I loved the work out. Mudder said dont you even think about it.  Mudders know best.
And tomorrow it will call for all sunny days  And when you wake up Saturday morning there will be 64cm of snow on the ground!!!!
Don't know which channel you're on, everything I've seen says less than 1 cm.
Its the americans that were saying we were gettin the pounding, canadian forecast models disagree it seems. Lets bet on who gets it right!
It's a balmy -15C tonite in Fort McMurray.  Monday night we had 4" of new snow along with 40 km winds.  I couldn't see the head ache ball at 100' radius.  You guys have it made!

, canadian forecast models disagree it seems. Lets bet on who gets it right!  I wouldn't be betting on the Weather Network!! Today it said "a few clouds" under current conditions. In fact, there was no blue sky visible nor had there been for several ours. If they can't get 'current conditions' right how are we to trust their forecast!!

Don't know which channel you're on, everything I've seen says less than 1 cm.  I have a bit of weather knowledge along with some friends in the " industry"  some times these guys are wrong but most of the time they are always on top of weather events in the area . Having said that , some squalls for Friday and some system snow for Saturday followed by more squalls Saturday night into Sunday . Storm is still building on the west coast but should intensify as it moves east .

Guess the Canadian guys changed their minds?   From Environment Canada (only selected area around Barrie, but alerts so other spots in Ontario):  3:41 PM EST Thursday 19 November 2015Special weather statement in effect for: Local snow squall activity likely tonight into Friday just east of Georgian Bay. Snow heavy at times on tap for late Saturday into Sunday morning for Grey Bruce and Central Ontario. For regions just east of Georgian Bay: showers are forecast to change to flurries and local snow squalls late tonight into Friday morning as temperatures drop behind a cold front. Although significant accumulations are not expected at this time, heavy flurries and local blowing snow could reduce visibilities. Travellers should prepare for winter driving conditions.Snow squall watches may be required as the event draws nearer.For Grey Bruce and Central Ontario: a low pressure system developing over southern plain states of the United States is forecast to track northeast into Southwestern and Central Ontario. Current guidance indicates that the system could potentially give total snowfall amounts of 10 to 15 cm.There is still uncertainity in the intensity and track of the system and Environment Canada will continue to monitor the situation and update the statement.Please monitor the latest forecasts and warnings from Environment Canada at www.weather.gc.ca.
Ah snow squatches, just a cousin to Samsquatch.
+12 here all day, high winds.  Fooled ya all. LOL
No such thing as 'bad weather', only inappropriate clothes!!!
No such thing as 'bad weather', only inappropriate clothes!!!

So many got caught off guard at the mine today it was hilarious!  Me, I packed my gear and had it ready.  Went from +15 to -15 over night with a big snow storm, 40kmp/h winds.  Many suffered, me, not so much lol. It still sucked but it is what it is.  For the first time in my life, on a mine site, I was sent home earlier due to poor conditions lol.  In northern alberta they would laugh
Actually not overnight, it rained last night, so over two days

Why I cancelled Thursday and Friday fishing. Leah and I have been busting our butts, until we can't stand up, getting our firewood out of the bush and piled before it's lost in the mess. Figure we have two more 8 hour days, just to get everything that I have cut and split on the ground loaded / out of the bush and piled.  I'm just hoping they're very wrong...  .... just  looked at weather. It shows no accum for Friday, less than 1cm Sat and 1 to 3 on Sunday (for Midland anyhow!)  An idea to make cutting your firewood more fun, and a little bit dangerous.  https://www.facebook.com/LarryTheCableGuy/photos/a.451669688463.247762.5677948463/10153760700958464/?type=3&theater

So many got caught off guard at the mine today it was hilarious!  Me, I packed my gear and had it ready.  Went from +15 to -15 over night with a big snow storm, 40kmp/h winds.  Many suffered, me, not so much lol. It still sucked but it is what it is.  For the first time in my life, on a mine site, I was sent home earlier due to poor conditions lol.  In Northern Alberta they would laugh  Yeah, they don't shut down here at all because of weather. They do close the winter road during blizzard conditions though.
There I got up this morning expecting a new white blanket, what a letdown, I guess we now know who can go and apply for a job with Environment Canada.
I saw a few snowflakes today.
Man I wish. Big oil/mining dont stop for nothing lol.  That was alright though cause your on the clock to get to whatever site you were working at so no real rush.  So different here
Just put the boat away today Dave.  It's a sad day... Won't get caught in a snow storm this year
Green here still. LOL  Talk to me mudder today. Snow in the morning,gone by noon.

We had about an hour of 1/4" to 3/8" ice balls, then a bit of snow and then I hit the bush to cut some more wood for the last 3 hours of daylight today. Hope they're wrong tomorrow and Sunday as well !
